thread.title: FIFA confirms ongoing proceedings against Blatter, two others
thread.title_full: FIFA confirms ongoing proceedings against Blatter, two others

author: customerservice@sportingnews.com (Sporting News)
title: FIFA confirms ongoing proceedings against Blatter, two others
text:
FIFA confirms ongoing proceedings against Blatter, two others Sporting News 2 hrs ago customerservice@sportingnews.com (Sporting News) © Rex/Action Press Sepp Blatter FIFA's Ethics Committee confirmed Wednesday that proceedings are ongoing against FIFA president Sepp Blatter, UEFA president and FIFA presidential candidate Michel Platini and FIFA general secretary Jerome Valcke, with a verdict targeted before their 90-day provisional suspensions are over.
AdChoices The three were given provisional 90-day bans on Oct. 8.
MORE: Classic photos of Pele | David Beckham through the years
Also on Wednesday, the Reuters news agency said Franz Beckenbauer and Angel Maria Villar were among other world soccer leaders under investigation.
Beckenbauer, a legend in Germany as a coach and player, is a former FIFA executive committee member. Villar is president of Spain's soccer federation and a vice president of FIFA and UEFA, which governs European soccer.
Blatter is accused of making a "disloyal payment" to Platini in 2011, as well as negotiating an unfavorable television contract involving former vice president Jack Warner. Valcke has been accused of misusing expenses and other infringements of regulations. All three deny any wrongdoing and have appealed .
Those sanctions can be extended by up to 45 days, which effectively ends Blatter's reign over world soccer — with the FIFA congress to replace him scheduled for Feb. 26.
The Ethics Committee said Wednesday it was continuing to investigate the allegations against the three men and will do everything possible to reach a speedy resolution.
A FIFA statement read: "The investigatory chamber of the independent Ethics Committee has confirmed that proceedings are ongoing against FIFA President Joseph Blatter and UEFA President Michel Platini, both of whom are currently provisionally suspended. The investigation is focusing on a payment of CHF 2 million from FIFA to Michel Platini in February 2011.
"The investigatory chamber will do everything in its power to ensure that a decision can be taken by the adjudicatory chamber of the Ethics Committee, chaired by Hans-Joachim Eckert, within the 90-day suspension period (which began on 8 October 2015) of the two football officials.
"The investigatory chamber also confirms the ongoing proceedings against suspended FIFA Secretary General Jerome Valcke related to the suspicion of misuse of expenses and other infringements of FIFA's rules and regulations."
The FBI and the attorney general of Switzerland are also conducting investigations.
